body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#25391](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25391) (guix: Use LTO to build releases by fanquake)
* [#24283](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/24283) (build: Add `show-%` target for multi-line variables and debug info by hebasto)
* [#22552](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/22552) (build: Improve depends build system robustness by hebasto)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

Should it be limited only for cases when glibc been used?
diff_hunk:
@@ -1,15 +1,18 @@
 package=expat
-$(package)_version=2.4.1
+$(package)_version=2.4.8
 $(package)_download_path=https://github.com/libexpat/libexpat/releases/download/R_$(subst .,_,$($(package)_version))/
 $(package)_file_name=$(package)-$($(package)_version).tar.xz
-$(package)_sha256_hash=cf032d0dba9b928636548e32b327a2d66b1aab63c4f4a13dd132c2d1d2f2fb6a
+$(package)_sha256_hash=f79b8f904b749e3e0d20afeadecf8249c55b2e32d4ebb089ae378df479dcaf25
 
+# -D_DEFAULT_SOURCE defines __USE_MISC, which exposes additional
+# definitions in endian.h, which are required for a working
+# endianess check in configure when building with -flto in Guix.
 define $(package)_set_vars
   $(package)_config_opts=--disable-shared --without-docbook --without-tests --without-examples
   $(package)_config_opts += --disable-dependency-tracking --enable-option-checking
   $(package)_config_opts += --without-xmlwf
   $(package)_config_opts_linux=--with-pic
-  $(package)_cflags += -fno-lto
+  $(package)_cppflags += -D_DEFAULT_SOURCE

body: Why? I think that over-complicated for what we need here.

+$(package)_version=2.4.8
 $(package)_download_path=https://github.com/libexpat/libexpat/releases/download/R_$(subst .,_,$($(package)_version))/
 $(package)_file_name=$(package)-$($(package)_version).tar.xz
-$(package)_sha256_hash=cf032d0dba9b928636548e32b327a2d66b1aab63c4f4a13dd132c2d1d2f2fb6a
+$(package)_sha256_hash=f79b8f904b749e3e0d20afeadecf8249c55b2e32d4ebb089ae378df479dcaf25
 
+# -D_DEFAULT_SOURCE defines __USE_MISC, which exposes additional
+# definitions in endian.h, which are required for a working
+# endianess check in configure when building with -flto in Guix.
 define $(package)_set_vars
   $(package)_config_opts=--disable-shared --without-docbook --without-tests --without-examples
   $(package)_config_opts += --disable-dependency-tracking --enable-option-checking
   $(package)_config_opts += --without-xmlwf
   $(package)_config_opts_linux=--with-pic
-  $(package)_cflags += -fno-lto
+  $(package)_cppflags += -D_DEFAULT_SOURCE

body:
> Considering that the _DEFAULT_SOURCE macro [implies](https://www.gnu.org/software/libc/manual/html_node/Feature-Test-Macros.html) a wider feature set than the _POSIX_C_SOURCE one, is it safe to define the former for a dependency while the latter been used in

I don't really think that makes much of a difference here. _DEFAULT_SOURCE is still only used for the expat build.
nit: A comment could be improved basing on this [comment](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25697#pullrequestreview-1050173051).

body: Addressed the suggestion and updated the PR description.

> It fails not only inside Guix, but for every cross-compiling, e.g.,:
> $ make -C depends expat_configured LTO=1 HOST=arm-linux-gnueabihf

This doesn't fail for me. What system is this on? What compiler are you using etc?

> > It fails not only inside Guix, but for every cross-compiling, e.g.,:
> > $ make -C depends expat_configured LTO=1 HOST=arm-linux-gnueabihf
> 
> This doesn't fail for me. What system is this on? What compiler are you using etc?

```
$ git rev-parse HEAD
31c1b14754574b0b0a54587e937fab66b3b85e39
$ git diff
diff --git a/depends/packages/expat.mk b/depends/packages/expat.mk
index 349319138e..50791ebc6e 100644
--- a/depends/packages/expat.mk
+++ b/depends/packages/expat.mk
@@ -9,7 +9,6 @@ define $(package)_set_vars
   $(package)_config_opts += --disable-dependency-tracking --enable-option-checking
   $(package)_config_opts += --without-xmlwf
   $(package)_config_opts_linux=--with-pic
-  $(package)_cflags += -fno-lto
 endef
 
 define $(package)_config_cmds
$ make -C depends expat_configured LTO=1 HOST=arm-linux-gnueabihf
...
configure: error: unknown endianness
 presetting ac_cv_c_bigendian=no (or yes) will help
...
$ arm-linux-gnueabihf-g++ --version
arm-linux-gnueabihf-g++ (Ubuntu 11.2.0-17ubuntu1) 11.2.0
Copyright (C) 2021 Free Software Foundation, Inc.
This is free software; see the source for copying conditions.  There is NO
warranty; not even for MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.

```
Not an expat bug, so I've submitted a report further upstream to autoconf: https://savannah.gnu.org/support/index.php?110687.
This has now also been fixed in autoconf upstream: https://git.savannah.gnu.org/cgit/autoconf.git/commit/?id=234fc6c86613ed3f366dd1d88996e4d5d85ee222.
